title: Baked Pork Chops with Cream of Mushroom Soup Recipe
description: These baked pork chops with cream of mushroom soup are made in the oven with just 5 ingredients for an easy weeknight meal the whole family will love.

The cream of mushroom soup gravy is great on both the pork chops and mashed potatoes. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ yellow onion, sliced 4 boneless pork chops 26 ounces condensed cream of mushroom soup ¼ cup water 2 cubes beef bouillon Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place onion slices on the bottom of a glass baking dish. Lay pork chops over onions. Cover chops evenly with condensed soup. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add water and bouillon, breaking up the bouillon cubes to spread flavor. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake pork chops in the preheated oven, stirring gravy once or twice, until no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a chop should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note You can use onion flakes if you don't have an onion on hand. I Made It Print 68 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Pork Chops with Cream of Mushroom Soup 01 of 04 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 04 Photo by  Danielle K 09/03/2021 I like how well mushrooms and pork chop go together. I paired it with bacon roasted green beans and mashed potatoes. The only thing I would do differently would probably be to sear the pork chops before adding everything else. Nice hearty meal! 03 of 04 Photo by  Mark Tabor 05/16/2021 04 of 04 Photo by  Tammy Lynn 04/23/2021 I followed this recipe exactly and was rather disappointed. They didn't have much flavor except for being very salty. Also, mine turned out rather tough. I cooked for another 20 minutes, and they were edible but definitely not fork tender.
